structure.unit: G KENTUCKY OFFICE OF HOMELAND SECURITY

law.catch_line: Kentucky Office of Homeland Security executive director -- Duties -- Delegation of duties -- Notification of disaster or emergency.

text.section: The Kentucky Office of Homeland Security shall be attached to the Office of the Governor and shall be headed by an executive director appointed by the Governor.
The executive director may delegate responsibilities created under this section to another executive branch agency.

The adjutant general, or his or her designee, shall concurrently notify the Governor and the executive director of the Office of Homeland Security of a disaster or emergency involving homeland security. The adjutant general, or his or her designee, shall be the Governor's primary point of contact for managing and responding to a disaster or emergency involving homeland security.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 2, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 193, sec. 1, effective July 12, 2006.
